meta.Flight: Offshore crew transfer from Zayed International Airport (AUH) to an ADNOC platform

timeline.title: Transponder Code 7500 Triggered
timeline.description: The Bell 412 transmits squawk code 7500, indicating unlawful interference. OCC immediately flags the incident as a potential hijack.
actions: Notify ATC and initiate ADA security protocol

timeline.title: Initial Contact Loss
timeline.description: Bell 412 is no longer responding on VHF/HF/ACARS.

timeline.title: Loss of Contact
timeline.description: Communication is lost with Bell 412 offshore flight. Initial attempts to reach the crew via VHF, HF, and ACARS fail.
actions: Attempt immediate contact via VHF, HF, and ACARS (ERP 2.6.5, 2.6.6)
Open Incident Log using Form B.6 and begin time-stamped entries
Notify the Duty Director of Operations (DOO) per ERP 2.2
Begin recording in digital event log (if available)

timeline.title: ELT Detected
timeline.description: Emergency Locator Transmitter (ELT) signal detected. Coordinates confirmed and authenticity validated.
actions: Confirm coordinates and signal authenticity with ATC and COSPAS-SARSAT if available (ERP 2.6.6, 2.6.7)
Initiate Aircraft Accident Notification using Form B.5

timeline.title: Emergency Escalation to HIGH
timeline.role: Duty Director of Operations (DOO) – EMT Chair
timeline.description: Based on the confirmed ELT signal and communication loss, the DOO classifies the situation as a HIGH emergency.
actions: Activate EMT based on Quick Response roles (ERP 2.5.2)
Brief Accountable Manager and Safety Director
Coordinate with OCC to maintain operational oversight
